definition: Edo (old name of Tokyo)
river/CL:條|条[tiao2],道[dao4]
surname Jiang
a household/door/family

sentences.english: In the Japanese Edo Period, the literary thought of "promoting virtues and punishing evils" was prevalent.
sentences.chinese: 日本江户时期，“劝善惩恶”文学思想盛行。

sentences.english: One Edo period practice is particularly conspicuous across Japan at the beginning of this month.
sentences.chinese: 本月初在日本重演全国江户时代的做法特别令人瞩目。

sentences.english: Castaways event was an important channel for exchanges between Japan and china during the Edo period.
sentences.chinese: 漂流事件是江户时代日中两国交往的重要渠道。

sentences.english: From Kudo to Edogawa, Shinichi is reaching the top of his life.
sentences.chinese: 从工藤到江户川，新一开始达到他生活的顶峰。

sentences.english: Historically this budget was part of the EDO function.
sentences.chinese: 在历史上，这是预算的一部分，江户时代的功能。

sentences.english: Edogawa Rampo deserves to be called the "father of Japanese detective fiction."
sentences.chinese: 江户川乱步不愧是“日本侦探小说之父”。

definition: Kamakura city in Kanagawa prefecture 神奈川縣|神奈川县[Shen2 nai4 chuan1 xian4], Japan
Kamakura bakufu 1192-1333, the first Japanese samurai shogunate
capital (of a country)
Kyoto, Japan
Heian period (794-1185), period of Japanese history
TOYOTOMI Hideyoshi (1536-1598), Japanese warlord, undisputed ruler of Japan 1590-1598
Muromachi bakufu, the feudal government of Japan (1338-1573) under the Ashikaga shoguns
ODA Nobunaga (1534-1582), Japanese shogun (warlord), played an important role in unifying Japan
Nara period (710-794) in early Japanese history
(orig.) tents forming the offices of a commanding officer/administration of a military government/(medieval Japan) "bakufu", administration of the shogun
the Japanese Meiji Restoration of 1868
Kagoshima, Japanese island prefecture off the south coast of Kyushu
MINAMOTO no Yoritomo (1147-1199), Japanese warlord and founder of the Kamakura shogunate 鐮倉幕府|镰仓幕府[Lian2 cang1 mu4 fu3]
Tokugawa, the ruling clan of Japan from 1550-1850
Ryūkyū kingdom 1429-1879 (on modern Okinawa)
ASHIKAGA Yoshimitsu (1358-1408), third Ashikaga shogun, reigned 1368-1394
Asuka Period in Japanese history (538-710 AD)
